member.summary: Represents a 6-dimensional emotional space for music composition. Each dimension is validated by psychology and music cognition research.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.EmotionalState.Tension
member.summary: Tension level from resolution (0) to climax (1). Related to harmonic tension, dissonance, and anticipation.

member.summary: Brightness level from dark (0) to bright (1). Related to major/minor mode, register, and timbre.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.EmotionalState.Energy
member.summary: Energy level from calm (0) to energetic (1). Related to tempo, rhythmic density, and dynamics.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.EmotionalState.Warmth
member.summary: Warmth level from distant (0) to intimate (1). Related to consonance, close voicing, and lyrical melody.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.EmotionalState.Stability
member.summary: Stability level from unstable (0) to grounded (1). Related to tonic vs. non-tonic harmony, metric regularity.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.EmotionalState.Valence
member.summary: Valence level from negative (0) to positive (1). The overall emotional character from sad/dark to happy/bright.

member.summary: Tracks information-theoretic properties of the composition. Based on information content (IC) and entropy measurements.

member.summary: Rolling average of information content per event. Higher values indicate more surprising/unpredictable music.

member.summary: Current local entropy (uncertainty about next event). Higher entropy means more possible outcomes.

member.summary: Peak information content seen so far.

member.summary: Bar number of the peak IC event.

member.summary: Number of high-IC events (surprises) so far.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.InformationState.LowICEventCount
member.summary: Number of low-IC events (predictable) so far.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.InformationState.TotalEvents
member.summary: Total events processed.

member.summary: Accumulated IC over the piece.

member.summary: Recent IC values for local analysis.

member.summary: Threshold for considering an event "low IC" (predictable). Default is 1.0 bits - about 1/2 probability.

member.summary: Gets the balance between surprise and predictability. Values near 0.5 indicate good balance.

member.summary: Gets whether the piece is currently in a high-information region.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.InformationState.InLowInformationRegion
member.summary: Gets whether the piece is currently in a low-information region.

member.returns: Positive for increasing, negative for decreasing, near zero for stable.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.ListenerModel
member.summary: Models the listener's cognitive state based on Huron's ITPRA theory. Tracks expectations, attention, and engagement.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.ListenerModel.Attention
member.summary: Current attention level (0-1). Attention naturally decays and is renewed by surprising events.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.ListenerModel.SurpriseBudget
member.summary: Current surprise budget - how much unexpected content is acceptable. High values allow more surprising events; low values need more predictability.

member.summary: Whether tension has been created that expects resolution.

member.summary: Recent prediction accuracy (rolling average). High values mean the listener is successfully predicting events.

member.summary: Recent surprise accumulation (for contrast effects).

member.summary: Number of musical events processed.

member.summary: Accumulated pleasure from contrastive valence (resolution after tension).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.ListenerModel.Engagement
member.summary: Current engagement level (derived from attention and prediction accuracy).

member.summary: Whether the listener is in a state of heightened anticipation.

member.summary: Schematic expectations - style-based probabilities (semantic memory).

member.summary: Veridical expectations - piece-specific memory (episodic memory).

member.summary: Dynamic expectations - work-in-progress patterns (short-term memory).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.ListenerModel.Conscious
member.summary: Conscious expectations - explicit predictions.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState
member.summary: Tracks the activation of BRECVEMA emotional mechanisms. BRECVEMA: Brainstem reflex, Rhythmic entrainment, Evaluative conditioning, Contagion, Visual imagery, Episodic memory, Musical expectancy, Aesthetic judgment.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.BrainstemReflex
member.summary: Brainstem reflex activation (0-1). Triggered by sudden loud sounds, dissonance, or rapid changes.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.RhythmicEntrainment
member.summary: Rhythmic entrainment activation (0-1). Triggered by strong, regular pulse patterns.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.EvaluativeConditioning
member.summary: Evaluative conditioning activation (0-1). Triggered by learned associations with musical elements.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.Contagion
member.summary: Emotional contagion activation (0-1). Triggered by perceiving emotion in the music's expression.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.VisualImagery
member.summary: Visual imagery activation (0-1). Triggered by music that evokes mental images.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.EpisodicMemory
member.summary: Episodic memory activation (0-1). Triggered by music that evokes personal memories.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.MusicalExpectancy
member.summary: Musical expectancy activation (0-1). Triggered by confirmation or violation of expectations. This is the ITPRA mechanism - the most relevant for composition.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.AestheticJudgment
member.summary: Aesthetic judgment activation (0-1). Meta-level appreciation of the music's qualities.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.TotalActivation
member.summary: Gets the total emotional activation (sum of mechanisms).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.DominantMechanism
member.summary: Gets the dominant mechanism (highest activation).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.ApplyDecay(System.Double)
member.summary: Applies natural decay to all mechanisms over time.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.ProcessEvent(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates mechanisms based on a musical event.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.TriggerImagery(System.Double)
member.summary: Triggers visual imagery (e.g., for programmatic/evocative sections).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.TriggerEpisodicMemory(System.Double)
member.summary: Triggers episodic memory (e.g., for theme returns).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.State.MechanismState.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this mechanism state.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace
member.summary: Represents Lerdahl's 5-level basic space hierarchy. The basic space defines the hierarchical organization of pitches within a tonal context. Source: Lerdahl, F. (2001). Tonal Pitch Space. Oxford University Press.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.Root
member.summary: The root pitch class of this basic space.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.Mode
member.summary: The mode of this basic space.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.RootLevel
member.summary: Level a: Root only (the tonic or chord root). Stability weight: 4

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.FifthLevel
member.summary: Level b: Fifth (root + perfect fifth). Stability weight: 3

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.TriadicLevel
member.summary: Level c: Triadic (root + third + fifth). Stability weight: 2

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.DiatonicLevel
member.summary: Level d: Diatonic scale degrees. Stability weight: 1

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.ChromaticLevel
member.summary: Level e: Full chromatic (all 12 pitch classes). Stability weight: 0

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.ModeType)
member.summary: Creates a basic space for the given root and mode.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale)
member.summary: Creates a basic space from a scale.

member.summary: Creates a basic space from a chord (chord space rather than key space).
member.param: The key context for diatonic level.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.GetStabilityLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the stability level (1-4) for a pitch class. Higher values indicate more stability.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.GetStabilityLevel(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass)
member.summary: Gets the stability level for a pitch class enum.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.GetLevelCounts
member.summary: Calculates the distinctiveness (number of pitch classes at each level). Used in the chord distance calculation.
member.returns: Array of counts for each level [a, b, c, d, e].

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace.GetDepth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the depth of a pitch in the basic space (Lerdahl's d(p) function). Depth is the sum of levels that contain the pitch.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordBasicSpace
member.summary: A basic space derived from a chord rather than a key. Used for chord-level pitch space calculations.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordBasicSpace.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,System.Int32,System.Int32,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale)
member.summary: Creates a chord-based basic space.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance
member.summary: Calculates chord distance using Lerdahl's Tonal Pitch Space formula. (xy) = i + j + k where: i = circle of fifths distance between chord roots j = number of distinct pitch classes in y's basic space not in x's k = number of non-common tones Source: Lerdahl, F. (2001). Tonal Pitch Space, Chapter 2.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Calculate(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates the full chord distance (xy) = i + j + k.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Calculate(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale)
member.summary: Calculates chord distance between two chords in a key context.
member.param: The key context for diatonic reference.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.CircleOfFifthsDistance(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass)
member.summary: Calculates the circle of fifths distance (i component).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.CalculateDistinctPitchClasses(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates the number of distinct pitch classes in target not in source (j component). This measures how different the diatonic collection is.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.CalculateNonCommonTones(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates the number of non-common chord tones (k component). Compares triadic pitch classes between chords.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.CalculateFromDegrees(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates a simplified chord distance for common progressions. Uses pre-computed values for standard functional progressions.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.GetRelativeTension(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale)
member.summary: Gets the relative tension of a chord based on distance from tonic.
member.returns: Relative tension value (0 = tonic, higher = more distant).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.SemitonesToFifths(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts semitone position to circle of fifths position.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference
member.summary: Common chord distance reference values for quick lookup.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference.TonicDominant
member.summary: I to V (or V to I) - strong functional relationship

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference.TonicSubdominant
member.summary: I to IV (or IV to I) - subdominant relationship

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference.TonicRelative
member.summary: I to vi (or vi to I) - relative minor/major

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference.TwoFive
member.summary: ii to V - pre-dominant to dominant

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ChordDistance.Reference.DeceptiveCadence
member.summary: V to vi - deceptive cadence

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence
member.summary: Calculates contrastive valence based on Huron's ITPRA theory. Final_affect Appraisal + |Reaction| Resolution pleasure scales with prior tension. Source: Huron, D. (2006). Sweet Anticipation, Chapter 2.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateResolutionPleasure(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the pleasure from resolution based on prior tension. Resolution after high tension produces more pleasure than after low tension.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateContrast(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the contrast effect between expectation and outcome. When outcome is better than expected = positive contrast. When outcome is worse than expected = negative contrast.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateItpra(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the ITPRA response sequence for a musical event.
member.param: Tension response to the event itself.
How well the outcome matched prediction (0-1).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateContrastiveEffect(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the contrastive effect between tension and resolution.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateCadencePleasure(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.CadenceResponse,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates expected pleasure for a cadence type.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.ShouldResolveNow(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines the optimal timing for resolution based on contrastive valence.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.ContrastiveValence.CalculateTargetTension(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the optimal tension level to build before resolution.

member.summary: Response from ITPRA calculation.

member.summary: Imagination response (anticipatory tension).

member.summary: Tension response (arousal).

member.summary: Prediction response (expectation match).

member.summary: Contrastive valence effect.

member.summary: Final affective response.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator
member.summary: Calculates Shannon entropy for musical probability distributions. H = - p log(p) Higher entropy indicates greater uncertainty/variety.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.Calculate(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates Shannon entropy from a probability distribution. H = - p log(p)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateFromCounts``1(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,System.Int32})
member.summary: Calculates entropy from a dictionary of outcomes and their counts.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateMaximum(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the maximum possible entropy for a given number of outcomes. H_max = log(n)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateNormalized(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates normalized entropy (0-1). H_normalized = H / H_max

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateMelodicEntropy(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Calculates entropy of a melodic interval distribution.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateRhythmicEntropy(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates entropy of a rhythmic pattern.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateHarmonicRhythmEntropy(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates entropy of harmonic rhythm (chord changes).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculatePredictability(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates the "predictability" of a sequence based on entropy. Lower entropy = more predictable.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateCrossEntropy(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates cross-entropy between predicted and actual distributions. H(p, q) = - p(x) log(q(x))

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.CalculateKLDivergence(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates KL-divergence between actual and predicted distributions. D_KL(P || Q) = P(x) log(P(x) / Q(x))

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.EntropyCalculator.Reference
member.summary: Reference entropy values for musical contexts.

member.summary: Entropy of uniform distribution over 12 pitch classes

member.summary: Entropy of uniform distribution over 7 scale degrees

member.summary: Entropy of typical melodic interval distribution

member.summary: Entropy of typical harmonic progression

member.summary: Low entropy threshold (predictable)

member.summary: High entropy threshold (unpredictable)

member.summary: Calculates Information Content (IC) for musical events. IC = -logP(event|context) Higher IC indicates more surprising/unexpected events. Source: Pearce, M.T. (2005). "The Construction and Evaluation of Statistical Models of Melody"

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction
member.summary: Calculates melodic attraction using Lerdahl's formula. = (s/s) (1/n) Where: s = stability of source pitch s = stability of target pitch n = distance in semitones between pitches Source: Lerdahl, F. (2001). Tonal Pitch Space, Chapter 5.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.Calculate(System.Int32,System.Int32,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates the melodic attraction from source to target pitch. Higher values indicate stronger attraction (more expected resolution).
member.param: The source pitch (MIDI number or semitone).
The target pitch (MIDI number or semitone).
The basic space context for stability calculation.
member.returns: Attraction value (typically 0.0 to 4.0, higher = stronger attraction).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.Calculate(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates melodic attraction using Pitch struct.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.CalculateAllAttractions(System.Int32,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the total melodic attraction from a pitch to all diatonic scale degrees. Identifies which pitch is most strongly attracted.
member.returns: Dictionary of target pitch class to attraction value.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.GetStrongestAttraction(System.Int32,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the most attracted target for a given source pitch.
member.returns: The pitch class with highest attraction, and its attraction value.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.CalculateExpectedness(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates the expectedness of a melodic resolution. High attraction means the resolution is expected; low means surprising.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.MelodicAttraction.CalculateVoiceLeadingRoughness(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.BasicSpace)
member.summary: Calculates voice leading smoothness based on attraction principles. Lower values indicate smoother voice leading.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicStoryteller.Theory.TensionCalculator
member.summary: Calculates tonal tension using the TIS (Tonal Interval Space) formula. T = 0.402Diss + 0.246Hier + 0.202TonalDist + 0.193VL Source: Navarro, M. et al. (2020). "A Computational Model of Tonal Tension"

member.summary: Weights from the TIS regression model.
